intro: Gymnanthes macrocarpa, commonly known as the giant cupseed, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant produces large, showy yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, orange-colored capsule that contains several seeds. Gymnanthes macrocarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
